How do I import a wallet export file into Verus using the `z_importwallet` command?

The `z_importwallet` command is used to import taddr and zaddr keys from a wallet export file into Verus. To do this, you need to specify the filename of the wallet export file as an argument.

The basic syntax of the command is:
```
verus z_importwallet "filename"
```
Here, `"filename"` is the path to the wallet export file that you want to import.

Before you can import a wallet, you need to export it first using the `z_exportwallet` command. For example, to export a wallet, you can use the following command:
```
verus z_exportwallet "nameofbackup"
```
This will create a wallet export file with the specified name.

Once you have the export file, you can import it using the `z_importwallet` command. For example:
```
verus z_importwallet "path/to/exportdir/nameofbackup"
```
Replace `"path/to/exportdir/nameofbackup"` with the actual path to your wallet export file.

Alternatively, you can also import the wallet using a JSON RPC call. To do this, you can use the following command:
```
curl --user myusername --data-binary '{"jsonrpc": "1.0", "id":"curltest", "method": "z_importwallet", "params": ["path/to/exportdir/nameofbackup"] }' -H 'content-type: text/plain;' http://127.0.0.1:27486/
```
Replace `"myusername"` with your actual username, and `"path/to/exportdir/nameofbackup"` with the actual path to your wallet export file.

Note that the `z_importwallet` command only imports the taddr and zaddr keys from the wallet export file, and does not import any other wallet data.

z_importwallet "filename"

Imports taddr and zaddr keys from a wallet export file (see z_exportwallet).

Arguments:
1. "filename"  (string, required) The wallet file

Examples:

Dump the wallet
> verus z_exportwallet "nameofbackup"

Import the wallet
> verus z_importwallet "path/to/exportdir/nameofbackup"

Import using the json rpc call
> curl --user myusername --data-binary '{"jsonrpc": "1.0", "id":"curltest", "method": "z_importwallet", "params": ["path/to/exportdir/nameofbackup"] }' -H 'content-type: text/plain;' http://127.0.0.1:27486/
